decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to utilize control elements, counterspells, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's strategy and eventually win the game through card advantage and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck aims to control the board with a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw, while also using cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Memory Deluge to dig deeper into the library for key cards. Additionally, the companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard provides additional value and synergy with the deck's creature lineup.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly equipping creatures with powerful artifacts such as Colossus Hammer and using synergies like Sigarda's Aid to deal massive damage early in the game. The deck includes cards like Kellan, the Fae-Blooded and Raubahn, Bull of Ala Mhigo to pressure opponents and close out games swiftly. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful equipment, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, high-impact plays to seize victory before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay through a combination of disruptive spells and powerful creatures. It aims to control the game early on with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, then overwhelm the opponent with evasive threats like Mockingbird and Moon-Circuit Hacker. The inclusion of Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Cecil, Dark Knight provides additional threats that can quickly end the game if left unchecked. With a mix of disruption and aggression, this Dimir Aggro deck looks to put pressure on the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total by efficiently using cards like Burst Lightning, Reckless Rage, and Monstrous Rage. The inclusion of creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Soul-Scar Mage complement the burn spells by providing additional damage or disruption. With a low land count and a focus on early aggression, the deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate extra mana and combo off with cards like Scapeshift and Thassa's Oracle. The goal is to ramp up quickly, control the board with Hedge Maze and Lumra, and then win the game in one explosive turn. The deck also includes some land destruction elements with Crumbling Vestige and Boseiju, Who Endures to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The Wandering Minstrel helps to dig for combo pieces, while Stock Up and Spelunking provide card advantage and manipulation. Overall, the deck aims to win through a powerful combo finish.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Liliana of the Veil and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to control the pace of the game, using cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to strip the opponent of key cards while using removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the board. The deck also has the ability to generate card advantage through cards like Castle Locthwain and Graveyard Trespasser and can win through incremental advantage or overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main focus of this red aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, along with creatures like Manifold Mouse and Emberheart Challenger, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and constant pressure. The inclusion of cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Monstrous Rage provide additional ways to deal damage and close out the game. The deck also includes some utility lands like Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins to provide extra reach.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Bishop of Wings, Righteous Valkyrie, and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to apply pressure to the opponent early on while also providing lifegain and protection for its creatures. Collected Company is used to help find additional threats and maintain tempo. The deck also includes a mix of ramp and utility cards like Elvish Mystic and Kayla's Reconstruction to support the aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, consistent aggro game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to get Arclight Phoenix onto the battlefield as quickly as possible and use cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to trigger its ability to return from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Artist's Talent and Treasure Cruise to help dig for more spells and maintain card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Spell Pierce provides some control elements, while the land base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and evasive threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for powerful combo plays. The key strategy involves using cards like Hidden Strings and Pore Over the Pages to untap Lotus Field and dig for combo pieces. Thespian's Stage can copy Lotus Field for additional mana generation. The deck also includes interaction and protection with cards like Strict Proctor and Lier, Disciple of the Drowned. Ultimately, the goal is to assemble the right combination of cards to generate a massive amount of mana and cast game-ending spells like Omniscience or Emergent Ultimatum.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. It also utilizes the companion mechanic with Kaheera, the Orphanguard. The main strategy is to keep the board clear with cards like Supreme Verdict and Field of Ruin, while constantly refilling your hand with card draw spells like Consult the Star Charts and Memory Deluge. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils provide additional card advantage and disruption. The deck aims to grind out the opponent and win through incremental advantage and resource denial.

The deck focuses on leveraging Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that can overwhelm opponents. It includes cards like Fleeting Spirit, Guardian of New Benalia, and Seasoned Hallowblade to provide support and protection for the combo pieces. Thoughtseize is included to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Fatal Push offers removal options. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency in casting them. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with control elements, utilizing cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Dovin's Veto to dominate the game. It also includes cards like Supreme Verdict to clear the board when necessary. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its win condition with cards like March of Otherworldly Light and The Wandering Emperor. Overall, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while also building up green devotion with cards like Cavalier of Thorns and Ulvenwald Oddity. Storm the Festival and Sylvan Scrying help to search for key cards, while Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner provides card draw and untapping capabilities. Leyline of the Guildpact helps with protecting your creatures and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx generates massive amounts of mana. Lair of the Hydra can be a powerful finisher, while Boseiju, Who Endures ensures your important spells resolve. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and mana advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and card draw to quickly fill the graveyard with spells and trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to bring it back from the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and spells while maintaining card advantage through Treasure Cruise and other draw spells. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Lightning Axe and Spell Pierce to control the pace of the game and protect key spells. The inclusion of unique cards like Temporal Trespass and Galvanic Iteration adds extra power and versatility to the deck.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful enchantments. The key strategy is to efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, allowing for early plays of impactful creatures like Bishop of Wings and Resplendent Angel. Collected Company is used to quickly flood the board with creatures, while Righteous Valkyrie and Giada, Font of Hope provide additional synergy and value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong, aggressive strategy.
